OUR CORE THEMATIC FOCUS/PROGRAMS


Sustainable Peacebuilding Initiatives

The Sustainable Peacebuilding Initiatives(SPIs) anchors a whole lot of peacebuilding programs/initiatives from local, national and international spectrums. Programs such as Domesticating Peacebuilding Process/Civic Peacebuilding,Fostering National & International Peace, and Peace Dialogue, Trainings & Mediations are all captured under the SPIs.

Youth Entrepreneurship

Global Youth Network for Peace to sustain itself shall run an ICT centre call GYNP School of Technology as an institution for the training of youths in ICT related courses with special focus on Website Designing, Digital Marketing and Mobile Application Development on a cost-reduced basis especially for members of the network. This shall also serve as an empowerment solution/safety nets for its beneficiaries.

Gender and Human Rights Advocacy

Gender and Human Rights violations/issues have made several headlines on almost all international platforms over the years, despite its discussions on almost all international forums including the United Nations Systems, there remain huge gap in achieving gender equality and ending human rights abuses globally, we firmly believe that with local and inclusive approach, we can create an equal and free society with the adherence to fundamental human rights as the core principles in every institutional setting.

Sustainable Peacebuilding Initiatives (SPIs)


Domesticating Peacebuilding Process /Civic Peacebuilding

Under the domesticating peacebuilding process, we undertake a number of projects and activities such as:-

  • Cultivating Intra and Inter-Personal Peace:

    We work with individuals on integrating peace in our own lives, with our children, in our relationships, in the workplace, and in our approach to activism, through such methods as compassionate communication, mindfulness, empathy, and stress reduction.

  • Conceptualizing the culture of Peace in Schools:

    Bringing into our schools conflict resolution curricula with tools such as social- emotional learning, communication techniques, restorative processes, mindfulness and other proven peacebuilding skills to increase graduation rates and transform violence, bullying, truancy, and other challenges facing youth.

  • Empowering Community Peacebuilding Process:

    We undertake and support comprehensive activities and strategies in communities working to address such challenges as crime, violence, and gangs. Effective programs may include hands-on street outreach and intervention, mental health services, out-of-school programs, police/community relations, and arts-based practices.

    Constructive engagement with ghetto youths and community stakeholders is core here to achieving this.


    Fostering National & International Peace

    Championing peacebuilding approaches to national and international conflict and atrocity prevention in hotspots through mediation, diplomacy, and effective on-the- ground programs. Important components may involve developing post-conflict justice systems, humanitarian aid, mediation and support for frameworks necessary for democratic processes. Global Youth Network for Peace shall forge partnership with other peacebuilding institutions at both national and international levels and shall assist international peacekeeping institutions in electoral monitoring and observances. We shall in addition undertake programs/campaigns such as; Humanizing justice systems, Protection and Safeguarding of Fundamental Human Rights, Research and provide Rapid Response/Intervention Mechanisms, Advocacy for policy formulation and Implementation. Through mediums such as Press conferences, blog posting, Journal and publications, Partnership etc, we can amplify our voices globally.

  • Humanizing Justice Systems

    Moving away from overly punitive policies, toward healing-oriented criminal and juvenile justice approaches. Restorative justice, diversion/alternative incarceration programs, trauma-informed systems, and prisoner rehabilitation & re-entry programs are among the most promising solutions. Our intervention shall focus on working with justice systems at national levels toward fair post-conflict justice, providing humanitarian aid, mediation and support for frameworks necessary for democratic processes.

  • Protection and Safeguarding of Fundamental Human Rights

    At Global Youth Network for Peace, human rights protection are at the core of our work, our team is dedicated to working with individuals, communities and state actors in protecting and safeguarding the fundamental human rights of everyone, everywhere. We incubate prompt response to human rights abuses.

  • Research and provide Rapid Response/Intervention Mechanisms

    The Research and Policy Evaluation Department at Global Youth Network for Peace is made up of experts in both qualitative and quantitative research. The team Conducts technical, multidisciplinary and result-oriented research on violent conflicts, political conflicts, terrorism, ethno-religious conflicts at local, national and international level which aids us to develop alternative methods of resolving conflicts of all kinds and promptly respond to arising violent conflicts.

  • Advocacy for policy formulation and Implementation

    Global Youth Network for Peace Seeks and supports legislations that support reduction of violence, addressing conflict before it escalates to violence, and ameliorating the effects of violence, we engage our network in direct grass-roots lobbying efforts to take peacebuilding to the center of our national discourse and make it a policy priority. We advocate for evidence-based peacebuilding legislation and policies that will enhance our capacity to reduce violence through prevention and intervention – building sustainable peace both domestically and internationally.

  • Peace Dialogues, Trainings & Mediation

    Through our peace building conferences, workshops, trainings and seminars, we engage people at different levels, from community peace mediation trainings and workshops, inculcating the culture of peace seminars to youth conference on peace and development, seminars on the status of youths, high-level panel dialogues on gender equality, we constructively engage people of diverse cultural, political, and religious orientations on peacebuilding dialogues as well as provide prompt response to violent conflicts and human rights abuses through human rights protection principles and the peaceful resolution of conflict and to modeling peace- making values at national and international levels.
